data.title: Fraternities
data.text:
Joining a fraternity at Pitt State is easy! Join us for one of our many events in the fall to meet members from each fraternity and find the chapter that most closely aligns with your goals at PSU.

Join IFC at one or all of the following events:

August 17th: House Tours

August 20th: Cookout

August 21st: Sand Volleyball

Email us to learn more!

The IFC is the governing board of all Fraternities on campus. The executive board is elected of representatives of all chapters and the board serves to lead the fraternity community in the proper direction.

The purpose of the Interfraternity Council is to:

Promote the best interest of the University and encourage a pursuit of excellence within the framework of an education

To assist and strengthen fraternities individually and collectively in the achievement of their worthy purposes and policies.

To provide a medium for the exercising of self-government and regulation of fraternity affairs

To offer opportunities and for further development of fraternity life on the campus

To act as liaison between fraternities and the University administration and faculty,

To offer a common meeting ground for all fraternities and foster fellowship and goodwill among fraternities and the student body as a whole.
